Since October 2013, I am a PhD student in the Condensed matter theory group of the Laboratoire de Physique Statistique (École Normale Supérieure, Paris), under the supervision of Werner Krauth. I am interested in the field of numerical simulations of condensed matter and cold atomic systems, and in particular I am working on quantum Path Integral Monte Carlo simulations for the unitary Bose gas. This work is based on some recent research activity in our group, see:
S. Piatecki and W. Krauth, Efimov-driven phase transitions of the unitary Bose gas (arXiv, Nature Communications).

News
  • Since January 2014, I have been part of the staff for the on-line course Statistical Mechanics: Algorithms and Computations on the Coursera platform.
  • On June 5-6, I will take part in the JDoc 2014 meeting, a gathering of all the PhD-students in Cold Atoms from France.
  • In the end of June, I will take part in the 4th Les Houches School in computational physics: From quantum gases to strongly correlated systems.
